ovdesc.p: This application contains the rules regarding which types of transaction take priority where there is more than one outstanding transaction against a settlement account. It ranks by EB,SYSTEM.ID. There are three linked tables

p.p: RC.PRODUCT.PRIORITY - Ranks by product within an EB.SYSTEM.ID

desc.p: The id to this table should be either a master or lead company
Valid master or lead company from COMPANY table
Value is set at product level
When this field is set, if the parent transaction fails then all the descendant txn fails
For example consider we have 5 txn A,B,C,D,E
If txn C fails then all descendant txn D and E also fails
PREV.SETTLE field will take priority over this field
If system id specific prev settle is left null,only then default prev settle option will be applied
This field is used to define the AA.PRODUCT.GROUP.
Can only be entered if the field EB.SYSTEM.ID is AAAA
Local reference field(s) defined by the user. Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement.
Up to 35 Any characters as defined in the local table definition for this local reference field.
(Optional input. Multi-valued field). Optional or mandatory input according to the LOCAL.TABLE definition for this field.
This is a multi valued field.
Contains details of any override applicable to this record.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered. This is a NOINPUT field.
This field is reserved for future use
This field is reserved for future use
This field is reserved for future use
This field is reserved for future use
This field can be used to decide if applications can change the prioritisation order of a list of pending transactions against a settlement account
If value exists,that routine is called with a list of RC.DETAIL IDs and records, which are already sorted by core recycler
This field can be used to decide if a local routine can change the prioritisation order of a list of pending transactions against a settlement account
If value exists, that routine is called with a list of RC.DETAIL IDs and records, which are already sorted by core recycler
Value is set at system id level
When this field is set, if the parent transaction fails then all the descendant txn fails
For example consider we have 5 txn A,B,C,D,E
If txn C fails then all descendant txn D and E also fails
This field will take priority over DEF.PREV.SETTLE field
Only if ths field is left null,then default prev settle option will be applied
This field is reserved for future use
This field is reserved for future use
This field is reserved for future use
This field is used to define the retry order where there is more than one transaction due per settlement account.
